<JD_START>
Job Title: Organizational Change Management Specialist 

Location: Baton Rouge Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Human Resources, Management, Project Management

Description:
Department: Human ResourcesReports To: Associate Director Total RewardsTravel Required: 25% 
Why Join Community Coffee? Community Coffee Company is the #1 family-owned and operated retail coffee brand in America. Rooted in family and tradition, yet always looking to the future, you can expect a fast-paced environment that is both challenging and rewarding. Join us and make your passion your profession!

Position Overview
The Organizational Change Management Specialist ensures success for projects within the organization by creating a smooth transition for the employee experience thereby increasing employee adoption and usage and minimizing interruption to business. This role plans for and fosters the success of the people side of changes that come with projects. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, preparing, supporting and equipping people to efficiently adopt change through strategies and plans that maximize adoption and usage of the required changes while minimizing resistant behaviors.
Function Related Activities/Key Responsibilities
Lead change management activities through the implementation of processes and tools that support adoption of changes required by a project.Support communication of projects through the creation and delivery of change management communications.Analyze the impact of changes and assess change readiness.Identify, analyze, and prepare risk mitigation strategies.Anticipate, plan for, analyze and manage resistance to change.Support and engage stakeholders, leadership, and project managers.Collaborate with team to support changes to organizational design through definition of roles.Ensure change management tasks are integrated into the main project plan.Define and measure success metrics and monitor change progress.Manage the change portfolio. This includes but is not limited to identifying issues that arise as a result of implementing various (sometimes simultaneous) changes within the organization.Develop tools for use by the organization to help manage change for smaller projects.May be asked to perform additional duties as necessary.
Position RequirementsBachelor’s degree from a four-year accredited college or university in Business, Human Resources Management or related field.5 year’s experience in Human Resources or 3 years’ experience in Organizational Change Management required. Experience in Organizational Change Management preferred.Experience with Community Coffee, even if unrelated, may fulfill this requirement at the discretion of the hiring manager with approval from Human Resources.Ability to interact with all levels of management and across a variety of functional areas.Ability to apply business acumen to identify issues and innovative solutions to support business objectives.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written, verbal).Ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality.
Physical Demands/Work EnvironmentThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to do the following:Frequently required to sitOccasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls and reach with hands and arms; and talk or hearRegularly required to lift and/or move up to 25 poundsSpecific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
